body.p:
Munfordville, Ky
May 1861,
To The Govenor of Kentucky

Your petitioners, the undersigned would most respectfully request that your Honor, remit so much of a judgment rendered against Thomas Hardy & J. T. Martin by the Hart Equity & Criminal Court, in favor of the Commonwealth, for one hundred dollars, on a bail bond ^or enough thereof as you are authorized to remit^. For the facts they refer to a letter to your honor from Wm B Jones, the Commonwealths atty for this District, and for many good reasons besides those enumerated in said letter they make this request.
